discoveredAssets: localhost:5003 - Python/Flask web application (Werkzeug 3.0.3 Python/3.9.23) - Port 5003, Token-based authentication
localhost:5003/login - Authentication endpoint (GET/POST) - Public, accepts credentials, returns JSON errors
localhost:5003/profile - Protected user profile endpoint - Requires token cookie authentication

targets.objective: Test authentication endpoint for credential-based vulnerabilities including SQL injection, NoSQL injection, default credentials, credential enumeration, and authentication bypass mechanisms
targets.rationale: Critical authentication endpoint that is publicly accessible and forms the primary security boundary for the application. Must be tested for injection vulnerabilities and authentication flaws

targets.objective: Test protected endpoint for authorization flaws including token manipulation, session hijacking, token validation bypass, horizontal privilege escalation, and data exposure vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Protected endpoint accessible only with valid token authentication. Requires testing for improper token validation, session fixation, and potential IDOR vulnerabilities if user-specific data is exposed

keyFindings: [HIGH] Authentication-based access control implemented - application requires valid credentials and token to access protected endpoints
[MEDIUM] Token-based authentication system uses cookie mechanism - potential for cookie-based attacks (session fixation, token manipulation)
[MEDIUM] JSON API endpoints detected alongside HTML form endpoints - indicates dual API/web interface
[LOW] Minimal attack surface - application appears to have limited endpoint exposure with only login and profile endpoints identified
